Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Donald Trump "cashed in" on Sept. 11 by collecting $150,000 in federal funds.
Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the 9/11 attacks on Trump's properties, as he stated that they were not affected by the attack.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support to conclusively prove that Trump took advantage of the program, as the evidence provided only mentions that his property met the criteria for the grant.
Problematic assumption: The claim may make the problematic assumption that receiving the federal funds meant Trump was "cashing in" on the 9/11 attacks, without considering other factors or intentions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may not consider alternative explanations for Trump's actions, such as his property being physically or economically damaged in some way that qualified him for the grant.
